We set sail, steered course toward Indies, Persian Gulf. At first I troubled sea-sickness, speedily recovered health. In voyage touched several islands, sold exchanged goods. One day becalmed near small island, little elevated level water, resembling green meadow. The captain ordered sails furled, permitted persons inclined land. While enjoying eating drinking, recovering fatigue sea, island sudden trembled shook us terribly. The trembling island noticed board ship, called upon re-embark speedily, lest lost; took island proved back sea monster.

After I rested dangers third voyage, passion trade love novelty soon prevailed. I therefore settled affairs, provided stock goods fit traffic I designed engage in. I took route Persia, travelled several provinces, arrived port, I embarked. On putting sea, overtaken sudden gust wind obliged captain lower yards take necessary precautions prevent danger threatened us. But vain; endeavors effect; sails split thousand pieces, ship stranded; several merchants seamen drowned, cargo lost. I good fortune, several merchants mariners, get upon planks, carried current island lay us. There found fruit spring water, preserved lives. We stayed night near place cast ashore.

All troubles calamities I undergone could cure inclination make new voyages. I therefore bought goods, departed best seaport; there, I might obliged depend upon captain, ship command, I remained till one built purpose, charge. When ship ready I went board goods; enough load her, I agreed take several merchants different nations, merchandise. We sailed first fair wind, and, long navigation, first place touched desert island, found egg roc, equal size I formerly mentioned. There young roc it, ready hatched, beak begun break egg. The merchants landed broke egg hatchets, made hole it, pulled young roc, piecemeal, roasted it. I vain entreated meddle egg.

On return home sixth voyage, I entirely given thoughts going sea; for, besides age required rest, I resolved expose risks I encountered, I thought nothing pass rest days tranquillity. One day, however, officer caliph's inquired me. "The caliph," said he, "has sent tell must speak you." I followed officer palace, where, presented caliph, I saluted prostrating feet. "Sindbad," said me, "I stand need services; must carry answer present King Serendib." This command caliph like clap thunder. "Commander Faithful," I replied, "I ready whatever majesty shall think fit command; I beseech humbly consider I undergone. I also made vow never leave Bagdad."

Then, clear, I heard Voice call: "Brothers! The dike breaking! The River comes! Link arms, brothers; dike bodies save home! Sisters, behind us, link arms! Close crevices, children! The River!" And multitude, I seen treading quietly grass fallen leaves prosperous feet, came hurrying, eyes longer fixed rich plain, lifted trouble defiance, staring rushing blackness. And Voice called: "Hasten, brothers! The dike broken. The River floods!" And answered: "Brother, come!" Thousands thousands pressed, shoulder shoulder—men, women, children, beasts lying behind, till living dike formed. And blackness came on, nearer, nearer, till, like whites glaring eyes, wave crests glinted dark rushing flood. And sound raging waters roar million harsh mouths. But Voice called: "Hold, brothers! Hold!" And living dike came answer: "Brother! We hold!"

At last donkey grew old longer use work, master wished get rid him. The donkey, fearing might killed, ran away. He took road Bremen, often heard street band playing. He liked music, thought might join band. He gone far came upon old dog. The dog panting, running long way. "Why panting, friend?" asked donkey. "Ah," said dog, "I old hunt. My master wished killed. So I ran away. But I find bread meat, I know." "Well," said donkey, "come me. I going play band Bremen. I think I easily earn living music. I play lute, play kettledrum." The dog quite willing, walked on.

Gilbert Brothers erected saw mill three years ago. A year later, Denison Paper Manufacturing Company, Mechanic Falls, erected big pulp mill, which, also, town voted exempt taxation ten years. The mills valuable companions other. The pulp mill utilizes waste saw mill. A settlement speedily built operatives. Gilbertville boasts post-office, store, several large boarding houses, nice school house, 500 inhabitants. The pulp mill employs seventy men. It runs night day. It manufactures monthly 350 cords poplar spruce pulp. It consumes monthly 500 cords wood fuel, 45 casks soda ash, valued $45 per cask, nine car loads lime, 24,000 pounds car. It produces 1,000,000 pounds wet fiber, valued $17,000, monthly. The pay roll amounts $3,500 per month.
